relation: There's a lot of events that go on and are put together by different organizations and its definitely worth attending. You meet many people.
I've never eaten at school regularly but sometimes it is expensive.

Living the dorm is a good experience. I didn't live in a dorm but I had a friend that did and I would spend most my time there. It's a good way to meet people but you have to acknowledge that sometimes living there can distract from your studies so you have to find people who you know will respect you and your studies. You also need to find people who you will be able to have a friendship with because things can happen and you could get into problems with each other.

Something I would tell students is to be ready because it does get difficult to get good grades if you are not dedicated. You have to start deciding what path you want in your life because you also don't want to spend money in courses you do not need.

Utep is a good school but maybe if they offered other majors dealing with arts like interior design or architecture or broader science degrees like forensic science that way students have a veariety of majors to choose. But this is a great school and great at what it does.
pageTitle: The University of Texas at El Paso (UTEP) Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {666338=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 486045=Restaurant selection is fantastic. A student can never go hungry. Unless it's a Friday. Nearly everything closes at 3:00 on Fridays, so students better eat early or take lunch for themselves., 485284=UTEP is #1 in student affordability with an average semester cost of less than $2500. It is much more than worth the cost., 446017=Theres an engineering march that goes around but i honestly havent experienced anything unusual...yet., 563631=My tuition was about $2250, which is pretty decent considering I'm an engineering major., 451832=UTEP is known for its engineering program. There is a tradition for engineering students that is near St Patrick's day in which students learn about the history of the university and do chants and walk all over campus. At the end they paint the letter M on the mountains which is for college of mine. UTEP was originally a mining school back in 1914., 5642=UTEP isn't incredibly expensive. I haven't had a problem covering the expenses. I had a grant for 1000 and a loan, and I was covered. The Food Courts are expensive to me, though. I prefer eating out of campus. There's some cool restaurants around UTEP., 247895=The city of El Paso was rated the safest city in the United States in 2010, making this one of the safest Universities in the country.}

textAfterTable: Christina from El Paso, TX 08/09/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 10 out of 13 people found this review useful. 2 of 161 Categories Comments Great for these types of students It's great for anyone, really. It's a well rounded college that will satisfy the needs of your specific character. The classes are good learning-wise. It depends on your major. The Engineering program is supposed to be one of the best, and the Music Program (from my perspective) is pretty good. The Music Department is growing more and more. Just search up your major, and see if UTEP has the best to offer for it. :) Tips for prospective students Have fun, and enjoy it. UTEP is great for learning, and connecting to those around you. Bang for the buck UTEP isn't incredibly expensive. I haven't had a problem covering the expenses. I had a grant for 1000 and a loan, and I was covered. The Food Courts are expensive to me, though. I prefer eating out of campus. There's some
